protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
documents: [{"url":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/uzrfw26.pdf","file_id":"19183","thumb_url":"/img/extensions/pdf.png","ofn":"Brain tissue dissociation for cell sorting HCA.pdf"}]
description: This is our standard brain tissue dissociation protocol for cell sorting (Human Cell Atlas).

materials.reagent_name: Shipping box with an insulated container that can be directly used for return transportation of the tissue sample
10X Hank’s Buffered Saline Solution (HBSS) without calcium or magnesium
High-walled 100 x 20 mm cell culture dish

warning: For safety warnings and hazard information please refer to the SDS (Safety Data Sheet).

groups.group_name: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

guidelines:
NOTE: A critical component of this protocol requires proper handling of the tissue donation starting immediately at the time of autopsy. The overall sample viability depends significantly on minimizing the post-mortem interval (PMI), immediately transferring tissue into the appropriate cold medium supplemented with antibiotics/antimycotics, keeping the sample on wet ice throughout transportation, and maintaining sterile technique throughout the protocol.

 

The protocols workflow is as follows:

 

1. Obtaining tissue samples (Steps 1-9)

2. Preparation for sample processing (Steps 10-15)

3. Mechanical dissociation (Steps 16-21)

4. Enzymatic dissociation (Steps 22-32)

5. Sucrose gradient centrifugation (Steps 33-39)

6. ACK red blood cell lysis (Steps 40-44)

 

Thumbnail Image: 

https://www.humancellatlas.org/areas-of-impact
status_info: We use this protocol in our group for primary DIPG tissue donations and it is working

components.data: Upon notification of an imminent donation, prepare a sample collection kit. Using a shipping box with an insulated container that can be directly used for return transportation of the tissue sample, include materials listed in the following steps.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Upon notification of an imminent donation, prepare a sample collection kit. Using a shipping box with an insulated container that can be directly used for return transportation of the tissue sample, include materials listed in the following steps.

source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting

The overall sample viability depends significantly on minimizing the post-mortem interval (PMI), immediately transferring tissue into the appropriate cold medium supplemented with antibiotics/antimycotics, keeping the sample on wet ice throughout transportation, and maintaining sterile technique throughout the protocol.

The overall sample viability depends significantly on minimizing the post-mortem interval (PMI), immediately transferring tissue into the appropriate cold medium supplemented with antibiotics/antimycotics, keeping the sample on wet ice throughout transportation, and maintaining sterile technique throughout the protocol.
source_data.body: A critical component of this protocol requires proper handling of the tissue donation starting immediately at the time of autopsy. The overall sample viability depends significantly on minimizing the post-mortem interval (PMI), immediately transferring tissue into the appropriate cold medium supplemented with antibiotics/antimycotics, keeping the sample on wet ice throughout transportation, and maintaining sterile technique throughout the protocol.

components.data: Include materials for sterile preparation, including sterile gloves, drapes, and scalpels.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Include materials for sterile preparation, including sterile gloves, drapes, and scalpels.

components.data: Include 8-10 sterile 50 mL conical tubes containing 30 mL shipping media in the insulated container with ice or cold packs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Include 8-10 sterile 50 mL conical tubes containing 30 mL shipping media in the insulated container with ice or cold packs.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 3 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.annotation: While any standard cell culture media can work, the best sample viability is obtained with Hibernate-A supplemented with antibiotic/antimycotic.
source_data.thread_text: While any standard cell culture media can work, the best sample viability is obtained with Hibernate-A supplemented with antibiotic/antimycotic.
source_data.body: While any standard cell culture media can work, the best sample viability is obtained with Hibernate-A supplemented with antibiotic/antimycotic.

components.data: Include any further sample tubes for other analyses (e.g. fixatives, RNA-later).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Include any further sample tubes for other analyses (e.g. fixatives, RNA-later).

components.data: If the autopsy will not be performed at the investigator’s site, include a document that clearly states how to collect the tumor sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If the autopsy will not be performed at the investigator’s site, include a document that clearly states how to collect the tumor sample.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 6 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.annotation: This includes details such as maintaining sterility, keeping sample tubes on wet ice, and including samples from the midbrain and medulla as tumor cells often invade these regions.
source_data.thread_text: This includes details such as maintaining sterility, keeping sample tubes on wet ice, and including samples from the midbrain and medulla as tumor cells often invade these regions.
source_data.body: This includes details such as maintaining sterility, keeping sample tubes on wet ice, and including samples from the midbrain and medulla as tumor cells often invade these regions.

components.data: Maintain sterility during the autopsy. Consider the brain sterile inside the cranium, so observe sterile technique (including changing gloves) once the cranium is open. Avoiding contamination with skin and hair is critical.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Maintain sterility during the autopsy. Consider the brain sterile inside the cranium, so observe sterile technique (including changing gloves) once the cranium is open. Avoiding contamination with skin and hair is critical.

components.data: Dissect the brain region of interest. With a sterile scalpel, cut small 1 cm chunks from the tumor and immediately transfer into cold shipping media (see NOTE in step 3) and put on wet ice. Place 10 mL of tissue into each tube, resulting in a final volume of tissue and media in each tube of 40 mL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dissect the brain region of interest. With a sterile scalpel, cut small 1 cm chunks from the tumor and immediately transfer into cold shipping media (see NOTE in step 3) and put on wet ice. Place 10 mL of tissue into each tube, resulting in a final volume of tissue and media in each tube of 40 mL.

components.data: After sample collection, ship the samples overnight on wet ice in the insulated container.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After sample collection, ship the samples overnight on wet ice in the insulated container.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 9 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.annotation: Do not ship the sample on dry ice, as freezing will kill the cells.
source_data.thread_text: Do not ship the sample on dry ice, as freezing will kill the cells.
source_data.body: Do not ship the sample on dry ice, as freezing will kill the cells.

components.data: Prior to beginning sample preparation, sterilize tissue culture hoods along with razor blades, curved hemostats, and any other non-sterile tools under UV light for 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prior to beginning sample preparation, sterilize tissue culture hoods along with razor blades, curved hemostats, and any other non-sterile tools under UV light for 1 hour.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 10 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.annotation: Perform all of the following steps under sterile conditions to prevent contamination of the cultures.
source_data.thread_text: Perform all of the following steps under sterile conditions to prevent contamination of the cultures.
source_data.body: Perform all of the following steps under sterile conditions to prevent contamination of the cultures.

components.data:
Prepare solutions as follows. 

 

[Sucrose Solution] To prepare 1.8 M sucrose solution, first, dissolve 308.07 g sucrose in 300 mL distilled water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare solutions as follows. 

 

[Sucrose Solution] To prepare 1.8 M sucrose solution, first, dissolve 308.07 g sucrose in 300 mL distilled water.

components.data: [Sucrose Solution] Add 50 mL 10X Hank’s Buffered Saline Solution (HBSS) without calcium or magnesium and bring total volume to 500 mL using distilled water. Store at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [Sucrose Solution] Add 50 mL 10X Hank’s Buffered Saline Solution (HBSS) without calcium or magnesium and bring total volume to 500 mL using distilled water. Store at 4°C.

components.data: [Enzymatic Digestion Solution] To prepare enzymatic digestion solution, first, take 50 mL HBSS with calcium and magnesium for every 10 mL of minced tissue and add 500 µL 5 mg/mL deoxyribonuclease I (final concentration 50 µg/mL), 500 µL 25 mg/mL Worthington STEMxyme I (final concentration 250 µg/mL), and 500 µL 1M HEPES buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [Enzymatic Digestion Solution] To prepare enzymatic digestion solution, first, take 50 mL HBSS with calcium and magnesium for every 10 mL of minced tissue and add 500 µL 5 mg/mL deoxyribonuclease I (final concentration 50 µg/mL), 500 µL 25 mg/mL Worthington STEMxyme I (final concentration 250 µg/mL), and 500 µL 1M HEPES buffer.

source_data.title: HBSS with calcium and magnesium for every 10 mL

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 13 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.annotation: Different enzymatic digestions solution mixes can be used at this step. We have also used Liberase DH at a final concentration of 25 µg/mL.
source_data.thread_text: Different enzymatic digestions solution mixes can be used at this step. We have also used Liberase DH at a final concentration of 25 µg/mL.
source_data.body: Different enzymatic digestions solution mixes can be used at this step. We have also used Liberase DH at a final concentration of 25 µg/mL.

components.data: [Enzymatic Digestion Solution] Prewarm digestion solution in a 37 °C water bath.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [Enzymatic Digestion Solution] Prewarm digestion solution in a 37 °C water bath.

components.data: Pre-cool a laboratory centrifuge equipped with a swinging-bucket rotor to 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pre-cool a laboratory centrifuge equipped with a swinging-bucket rotor to 4°C.

components.data: Transfer the tissue into a high-walled 100 x 20 mm cell culture dish.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the tissue into a high-walled 100 x 20 mm cell culture dish.

components.data: Remove media leftover from shipping and replace with 10-15 mL cold culture media (e.g., Hibernate-A).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove media leftover from shipping and replace with 10-15 mL cold culture media (e.g., Hibernate-A).

components.data: Using the curved hemostats to grasp a razor blade, mince the tissue finely while removing obvious blood vessels or meninges.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using the curved hemostats to grasp a razor blade, mince the tissue finely while removing obvious blood vessels or meninges.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 18 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.annotation: The final tissue fragments should be smaller than 1 mm.
source_data.thread_text: The final tissue fragments should be smaller than 1 mm.
source_data.body: The final tissue fragments should be smaller than 1 mm.

components.data: Transfer the tissue into a clean 50 mL conical tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the tissue into a clean 50 mL conical tube.

components.data: Wash the cell culture dish with an additional 5 mL cold culture media and transfer to the conical tube. Repeat this wash step as necessary to transfer remaining tissue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the cell culture dish with an additional 5 mL cold culture media and transfer to the conical tube. Repeat this wash step as necessary to transfer remaining tissue.

components.data: Using a 10 mL serological pipet, triturate gently (4-5 times). Allow larger tissue fragments to settle to the bottom of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using a 10 mL serological pipet, triturate gently (4-5 times). Allow larger tissue fragments to settle to the bottom of the tube.

components.data: If there is more than 5 mL of tissue in the tube containing the minced tissue fragments, split the tissue into other new 50 mL conical tubes such that no tube has more than 5 mL tissue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If there is more than 5 mL of tissue in the tube containing the minced tissue fragments, split the tissue into other new 50 mL conical tubes such that no tube has more than 5 mL tissue.

components.data: Centrifuge the conical tube(s) containing the remaining tissue fragments for 5 min (350 x g, 4°C).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the conical tube(s) containing the remaining tissue fragments for 5 min (350 x g, 4°C).

components.data: Remove the supernatant and add the prewarmed enzymatic digestion solution, such that there is 5 mL digestion solution for every 1 mL tissue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the supernatant and add the prewarmed enzymatic digestion solution, such that there is 5 mL digestion solution for every 1 mL tissue.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 24 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.annotation: E.g. 25 mL digestion solution for 5 mL tissue.
source_data.thread_text: E.g. 25 mL digestion solution for 5 mL tissue.
source_data.body: E.g. 25 mL digestion solution for 5 mL tissue.

components.data: Seal the conical tube lids with laboratory film and incubate the reaction on a rotator at 37°C for 30 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal the conical tube lids with laboratory film and incubate the reaction on a rotator at 37°C for 30 min.

components.data: After the incubation, to triturate the samples gently, first, using a 10 mL serological pipet, pipet the sample up and down 6-8 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the incubation, to triturate the samples gently, first, using a 10 mL serological pipet, pipet the sample up and down 6-8 times.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 27 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting

components.data: Add a 1000 µL pipet tip to the end of the pipet and triturate an additional 6-8 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add a 1000 µL pipet tip to the end of the pipet and triturate an additional 6-8 times.

components.data: Allow any remaining chunks to settle to the bottom of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow any remaining chunks to settle to the bottom of the tube.

components.data: Remove and filter the supernatant with the cells still suspended through a 100 µm filter into a new 50 mL conical tube labeled 'Enzymatic Dissociation' and store on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove and filter the supernatant with the cells still suspended through a 100 µm filter into a new 50 mL conical tube labeled 'Enzymatic Dissociation' and store on ice.

components.data: If significant tissue fragments remain in the unfiltered fraction, add an additional 10 mL HBSS with calcium and magnesium to the fragments and repeat steps 25-28, combining the additional HBSS into the previously filtered supernatant in the 'Enzymatic Dissociation' tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If significant tissue fragments remain in the unfiltered fraction, add an additional 10 mL HBSS with calcium and magnesium to the fragments and repeat steps 25-28, combining the additional HBSS into the previously filtered supernatant in the 'Enzymatic Dissociation' tube.

components.data: Centrifuge the 'Enzymatic Dissociation' tube for 5 min (350 x g, 4°C) and continue to sucrose gradient centrifugation (next step).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the 'Enzymatic Dissociation' tube for 5 min (350 x g, 4°C) and continue to sucrose gradient centrifugation (next step).

components.data: If samples are still suspended in solution, centrifuge for 5 min (350 x g, 4°C)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If samples are still suspended in solution, centrifuge for 5 min (350 x g, 4°C)

components.data: Remove the supernatant and resuspend tissue in 20 mL cold HBSS without calcium and magnesium. Bring volume up to 25 mL total with cold HBSS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the supernatant and resuspend tissue in 20 mL cold HBSS without calcium and magnesium. Bring volume up to 25 mL total with cold HBSS.

source_data.title: Cold HBSS without calcium and magnesium

components.data: Slowly add 25 mL 1.8 M sucrose solution and invert the tube to mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slowly add 25 mL 1.8 M sucrose solution and invert the tube to mix.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 35 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.annotation: This results in a 0.9 M sucrose gradient.
source_data.thread_text: This results in a 0.9 M sucrose gradient.
source_data.body: This results in a 0.9 M sucrose gradient.

components.data: Centrifuge with no brake for 10 min (800 x g, 4°C).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge with no brake for 10 min (800 x g, 4°C).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 36 of Brain tissue dissociation
source_data.protocol_name: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.protocol_name_html: Brain Tissue Dissociation for Cell Sorting
source_data.annotation: Using a centrifugation brake will disrupt the gradient and reduce yield.
source_data.thread_text: Using a centrifugation brake will disrupt the gradient and reduce yield.
source_data.body: Using a centrifugation brake will disrupt the gradient and reduce yield.

components.data: Carefully aspirate myelin debris and as much sucrose solution as possible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully aspirate myelin debris and as much sucrose solution as possible.

components.data: Wash the sample by adding 30 mL cold HBSS without calcium and magnesium and mixing gently.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the sample by adding 30 mL cold HBSS without calcium and magnesium and mixing gently.

source_data.title: Cold HBSS without calcium and magnesium

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 5 min (350 x g, 4°C).
Remove the wash supernatant.

components.data: Add 5 mL ACK lysis buffer and gently resuspend the cell pellet, swirling the tube for 1 min at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5 mL ACK lysis buffer and gently resuspend the cell pellet, swirling the tube for 1 min at room temperature.

components.data: Quench the lysis by adding 30 mL cold HBSS without calcium and magnesium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Quench the lysis by adding 30 mL cold HBSS without calcium and magnesium.

source_data.title: Cold HBSS without calcium and magnesium

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 5 min (350 x g, 4°C).

components.data: Resuspend samples in appropriate staining buffer for subsequent analysis, such as flow cytometry and fluorescence-activated cell sorting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend samples in appropriate staining buffer for subsequent analysis, such as flow cytometry and fluorescence-activated cell sorting.

components.data: Filter the Sucrose and Enzymatic Digestion solutions through a sterile (0.22μm) filter
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter the Sucrose and Enzymatic Digestion solutions through a sterile (0.22μm) filter
